org.mt4j.input.inputData
Class InputCursor

java.lang.Object
  org.mt4j.input.inputData.InputCursor

public class InputCursor
extends java.lang.Object

This is a container for AbstractCursorInputEvt Events with a unique ID, identifying the cursor. The cursor contains all cursor events of the correspinding cursor (or finger when using multi-touch). Also, the cursor allows the input processors to negotiate who has priority to use (lock) this cursor.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

getLock

public boolean getLock(AbstractCursorProcessor ia)
Locks this cursor with the specified processor if the processors lock priority is higher or equal than the current lock priority of this cursor.

Parameters:
ia - the AbstractCursorProcessor
Returns:
true if sucessfully locked

registerForLocking

public void registerForLocking(AbstractCursorProcessor ia)
Input processors should call this when new input has started to be able to use the cursor locking mechanisms.

Parameters:
ia - the ia

unregisterForLocking

public void unregisterForLocking(AbstractCursorProcessor ia)
Input processors should call this when input has ended.

Parameters:
ia - the ia

unlock

public void unlock(AbstractCursorProcessor ia)
Unlocks this cursor from the specified processor. If the priority by which this cursor is locked changes by that, the cursorUnlocked method is invoked on processors with a lower priority who by that get a chance to lock this cursor again.

Parameters:
ia - the AbstractCursorProcessor

getVelocityVector

public Vector3D getVelocityVector()
Calculates and returns the velocity vector. The calculation takes the events of the last milliseconds into account. The calculation is not physically correct but provides a good vector to use as inertia.

Returns:
the velocity vector

getVelocityVector

public Vector3D getVelocityVector(int millisAgo)
Calculates and returns the velocity vector. The calculation takes the events of the last milliseconds into account. The calculation is not physically correct but provides a good vector to use as inertia.

Parameters:
millisAgo - the all events from millis ago are taken into calculation
Returns:
the velocity vector
